Slavoj Žižek

"I would prefer not to."[1]

Few extracts from Slavoj Žižek's life - the "Elvis of Cultural Studies"

  • 1949 - Slavoj Žižek is borne in Ljubljana, Slovenia.
  • 1967 - Beginning of philosophy and sociology studies at the University of Ljubljana.
  • 1972 - His first book The Pain of Difference (org. Bolečina razlike) is being published.
  • 1981 - He became Doctor of Arts in Philosophy, dissertation titled The Theoretical and Practical Relevance of French Structuralism.
  • 1985 - Defended his second PhD dissertation at the University of Paris VIII and became Doctor of Philosophy in psychoanalysis
  • 1989 - One of most important books for his career is published - Sublime Object of Ideology, the first one translated to English.
  • 1990 - Runs for four-person collective presidency of Slovenia.
  • 1991-1999 He is involved in teaching i.a. at University of Minnesota, Tulane University, Columbia University, Princeton University and University of Michigan
  • 2004 - A movie The Reality of the Virtual is being released.
  • 2006 - The Parallax View is published and the movie The Pervert's Guide to Cinema is released.
  • 2012 - The Pervert's Guide to Ideology is released.

If you are interested more in Slavoj Žižek's biography, visit dedicated to him Wikipedia entry or notablebiographies.com.

[1] Quote from "Bartleby, the Scrivener: A Story of Wall Street" written by Herman Melville - for more information read this article.
